channel.title: BBC News - Home

item.title: Norwich: Two of four found dead in house were stabbed, police say
item.description: Norfolk Police investigating the deaths of four people in Costessey, say two adults died from stab wounds.

item.title: Ron DeSantis drops out of presidential race and backs Trump
item.description: The Florida governor ends his bid for the Republican nomination and endorses Donald Trump ahead of New Hampshire vote.

item.title: In Ukraine's river war, drones mean nowhere is safe
item.description: Ukraine aims to build a million military drones in 2024. In Kherson, the BBC saw how vital they are.

item.title: More than 25,000 now killed in Gaza since Israel offensive began, Hamas-run health ministry says
item.description: The grim milestone comes as Israel presses its war in Gaza and rejects calls for a Palestinian state.

item.title: Sarah Ferguson: Duchess of York diagnosed with skin cancer
item.description: A spokesperson says a cancerous mole was found while the duchess was having reconstructive surgery.

item.title: Birmingham teenager Muhammad Hassam Ali killed in a case of 'mistaken identity'
item.description: Muhammad Hassam Ali is named as the boy stabbed to death in Birmingham city centre on Saturday.

item.title: Airports to miss deadline for installing scanners
item.description: Some will not have all the tech, which will end the 100ml limit on liquids, ready by 1 June.

item.title: Ayodhya: India PM Modi to open Hindu temple on razed Babri mosque site
item.description: Ayodhya is spruced up for the Ram temple launch, but opposition leaders and some Hindu seers are staying away.

item.title: Nearly 90 dead after fierce winter storms strike US
item.description: At least 25 weather-related deaths have been reported in Tennessee, with another 16 in Oregon.

item.title: Ofsted: Head teachers can request pause as inspections resume
item.description: Lead inspectors in England were given mental health awareness training during the two-week pause.

item.title: Start-ups frustrated by HMRC's 'slowness and lack of communication'
item.description: Delays and a lack of communication from the tax authority are holding back new businesses, a group says.

item.title: Lake Michigan: Freezing weather causes striking ice formations
item.description: The cold weather in the US has caused natural ice sculptures to form in Grand Haven, Michigan.

item.title: The Papers: 'Fergie cancer shock' and 'vish-ous' storm
item.description: Monday's front pages carry the news of the Duchess of York's cancer diagnosis and anticipate the impact of Storm Isha.

item.title: The bomb-hunters scouring UK waters for unexploded weapons
item.description: Experts say hundreds of thousands of unspent munitions lie on the seabed around Britain.

item.title: Travel Photographer of the Year: Lyrical landscapes win awards
item.description: Travel Photographer of the Year awards recognise incredible pictures from around the planet.

item.title: 'Drugged, robbed, killed': The city catching US tourists in dating trap
item.description: Relatives of men killed in Medellin after meeting local women for dates are now searching for answers.

item.title: I'm working but homeless and bottom of the housing list
item.description: A working father finds himself "sofa surfing" amid social housing shortages in Scotland's biggest city.

item.title: 'Say you're sorry': Russia's trend for humiliating videos
item.description: Forced video apologies have become increasingly common since Russia's war in Ukraine began.

item.title: Cancer survivors empowered by posing nude for calendar
item.description: The women started off petrified but ended up like goddesses, the photographer says.

item.title: Bowels, bladders and sex: Rediscovering life after mountain crash
item.description: Extreme sportsman Niall McCann talks frankly about life after crashing into a mountain at 50mph.

item.title: Measles: Why are cases rising and what are the symptoms?
item.description: People are encouraged to have the MMR jab, as cases of measles are on the increase.

item.title: Joseph Boakai: Liberia's new president takes on tough challenge
item.description: Can Joseph Boakai, 79, change Liberia's fortunes, as he takes over from ex-footballer George Weah?

item.title: Great Yarmouth: Murder charge after woman's body found
item.description: Further tests are being carried out into the cause of death, Norfolk Police say.

item.title: Donetsk: Deadly blast hits market in Russia-held Ukraine city, officials say
item.description: Ukraine rejects accusations from the region's Moscow-installed leader that it was responsible.

item.title: Tesco tech hitch leaves deliveries in 'shambles'
item.description: It is thought thousands of customers were left without their orders due to technical problems.

item.title: Football racism: Forfeit matches when fans are racist - Fifa's Infantino
item.description: Fifa president Gianni Infantino calls for an automatic forfeit of games for teams whose fans commit racist abuse.

item.title: Baroness Mone 'is her own worst enemy' - Sir Tom Hunter
item.description: The businessman said Michelle Mone had given a "car-crash" interview on her part in a PPE deal.

item.title: Shapps 'disappointed' by Netanyahu opposition to Palestinian state
item.description: It is the only solution to end conflict between Israel and the Palestinians, says the defence secretary.

item.title: Gut health: Goat milk firm's poo post-box tests microbiome
item.description: The company sends stool samples to the University of Cambridge for microbiome analysis.

item.title: Ukraine drones hit St Petersburg gas terminal in Russia
item.description: An official in Kyiv tells the BBC the "special operation" is an economic blow to Russia.

item.title: Yousaf offers talks with 'next prime minister' Starmer
item.description: Scotland's first minister is "very willing" to work with Sir Keir Starmer if Labour win the general election.

item.title: Bournemouth 0-4 Liverpool: A 'winning machine' - Danny Murphy analysis on why Liverpool did not miss stars
item.description: MOTD2 pundit and ex-Liverpool midfielder Danny Murphy says the Reds showed against Bournemouth that they can fill the void left by Mohamed Salah and Trent Alexander-Arnold.

item.title: Celtic 5-0 Buckie Thistle: Holders end Highlanders League side's Scottish Cup adventure
item.description: Holders Celtic power into last 16 in sodden conditions as Buckie Thistle's Scottish Cup adventure ends in Glasgow.

item.title: Moyes questions officiating but does he deserve more fan respect?
item.description: What happened in the game's final 10 chaotic minutes & does David Moyes deserve the grief he gets from some of his own fans?

item.title: Ronnie O'Sullivan beats Judd Trump 10-7 to win World Grand Prix final
item.description: Ronnie O'Sullivan comes back from 4-0 down to beat Judd Trump 10-7 in the World Grand Prix final.

item.title: Match of the Day 2: How Diogo Jota shone for Liverpool in Mo Salah's absence
item.description: Match of the Day 2's Shay Given analyses how Diogo Jota "stepped up" for Liverpool against Bournemouth, with Reds' talisman Mo Salah away on international duty.

item.title: Match of the Day 2: Were West Ham 'cheated' by penalty calls against Sheffield United?
item.description: Match of the Day 2's Danny Murphy and Shay Given analyse two controversial penalty decisions which gave Sheffield United a 2-2 draw against West Ham at Bramall Lane.
